briefdescription.para: Needed so that voice_state_update can call dpp::discord_client::disconnect_voice_internal.
Needed so that guild_create can request member chunks if you have the correct intents.
Needed to allow cluster::set_presence to use the ETF functions.
True if the shard is terminating.
Output buffer for sending to socket.
True if in nonblocking mode. The socket switches to nonblocking mode once ReadLoop is called.
True for a plain text connection.
True if we are establishing a new connection, false if otherwise.
Thread this shard is executing on.
If true, stream compression is enabled.

This object contains the various zlib structs which are not usable by the user of the library directly. They are wrapped within this opaque object so that this header file does not bring in a dependency on zlib.h.
Time last ping sent to websocket, in fractional seconds.
ETF parser for when in ws_etf mode.
Heartbeat interval for sending heartbeat keepalive.
Last sequence number received, for resumes and pings.
True if READY or RESUMED has been received.
Current websocket protocol, currently either ETF or JSON.
List of voice channels we are connecting to keyed by guild id.
The gateway address we reconnect to when we resume a session.
Attaching an additional file descriptor to this function will send notifications when there is data to read.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: Only hook this if you NEED it as it can increase CPU usage of the thread! Returning -1 means that you don't want to be notified.

briefdescription.para: Attaching an additional file descriptor to this function will send notifications when you are able to write to the socket.

detaileddescription.para: NOTE: Only hook this if you NEED it as it can increase CPU usage of the thread! You should toggle this to -1 when you do not have anything to write otherwise it'll keep triggering repeatedly (it is level triggered).

briefdescription.para: This event will be called when you can read from the custom fd.
This event will be called when you can write to a custom fd.
True if we are keeping the connection alive after it has finished.
Disconnect from the connected voice channel on a guild.

parameterdescription.para: The guild who's voice channel you wish to disconnect from
True if we should send a json message confirming we are leaving the VC Should be set to false if we already receive this message in an event.

briefdescription.para: Run shard loop under a thread. Calls discord_client::run() from within a std::thread.
Convert a JSON object to string. In JSON protocol mode, call json.dump(), and in ETF mode, call etf::build().

parameterdescription.para: nlohmann::json object to convert

simplesect.para: std::string string output in the correct format

parameterdescription.para: if ZLib cannot be initialised

briefdescription.para: Update the websocket hostname with the resume url from the last READY event.
Log a message to whatever log the user is using. The logged message is passed up the chain to the on_log event in user code which can then do whatever it wants to do with it.

parameterdescription.para: The log level from dpp::loglevel
The log message to output
Event name, e.g. MESSAGE_CREATE
JSON object for the event content
Raw JSON event string

briefdescription.para: Get the Guild Count for this shard.
Get the Member Count for this shard.
Get the Channel Count for this shard.

detaileddescription.para: Fires every second from the underlying socket I/O loop, used for sending heartbeats

briefdescription.para: Queue a message to be sent via the websocket.

parameterdescription.para: The JSON data of the message to be sent
If set to true, will place the message at the front of the queue not the back (this is for urgent messages such as heartbeat, presence, so they can take precedence over chunk requests etc)

briefdescription.para: Get the size of the outbound message queue.
Returns true if the shard is connected.
Returns the connection time of the shard.

simplesect.para: dpp::utility::uptime Detail of how long the shard has been connected for

memberdef.argsstring: (dpp::cluster *_cluster, uint32_t _shard_id, uint32_t _max_shards, const std::string &_token, uint32_t intents=0, bool compressed=true, websocket_protocol_t ws_protocol=ws_json)
memberdef.name: discord_client

parameterdescription.para: The owning cluster for this shard
The ID of the shard to start
The total number of shards across all clusters
The bot token to use for identifying to the websocket
Privileged intents to use, a bitmask of values from dpp::intents
True if the received data will be gzip compressed
Websocket protocol to use for the connection, JSON or ETF
Passed up to the caller if any internal objects fail to allocate, after cleanup has completed

briefdescription.para: Get the decompressed bytes in objectGet decompressed total bytes received.

parameterdescription.para: The entire buffer content from the websocket client

simplesect.para: True if a frame has been handled

parameterdescription.para: The error returned from the websocket

simplesect.para: this is a blocking call and is usually executed within a thread by whatever creates the object.

memberdef.argsstring: (snowflake guild_id, snowflake channel_id, bool self_mute=false, bool self_deaf=false)
memberdef.name: connect_voice

parameterdescription.para: Guild where the voice channel is
Channel ID of the voice channel
True if the bot should mute itself
True if the bot should deafen itself

simplesect.para: This is NOT a synchronous blocking call! The bot isn't instantly ready to send or listen for audio, as we have to wait for the connection to the voice server to be established! e.g. wait for dpp::cluster::on_voice_ready event, and then send the audio within that event.

briefdescription.para: Disconnect from the connected voice channel on a guild.

parameterdescription.para: The guild who's voice channel you wish to disconnect from

simplesect.para: This is NOT a synchronous blocking call! The bot isn't instantly disconnected.

briefdescription.para: Get the dpp::voiceconn object for a specific guild on this shard.

parameterdescription.para: The guild ID to retrieve the voice connection for

simplesect.para: voiceconn* The voice connection for the guild, or nullptr if there is no voice connection to this guild.

briefdescription.para: Write to websocket. Encapsulates data in frames if the status is CONNECTED.

parameterdescription.para: The data to send.

briefdescription.para: Processes incoming frames from the SSL socket input buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer contents. Can modify this value removing the head elements when processed.

briefdescription.para: Send OP_CLOSE error code 1000 to the other side of the connection. This indicates graceful close.
Get the bytes out objectGet total bytes sent.

parameterdescription.para: Any std::exception (or derivative) thrown from read_loop() causes reconnection of the shard

briefdescription.para: Implements a discord client. Each discord_client connects to one shard and derives from a websocket client.
